The significant trade imbalance between France and China
subhead: Even as Chinese competition increasingly undermines French industries, including in innovation, many French companies argue that maintaining a presence in China remains essential. President Emmanuel Macron is visiting the country from December 3 to 5.

'Nighttime prohibition': Warsaw city center bans alcohol sales at night
subhead: Nearly 180 municipalities in Poland have already opted to ban the sale of alcohol at night. On November 1, two central districts in Warsaw followed suit. The measure, which was initially intended to apply across the entire capital, has sparked heated debate.

title: Afghan man pleads not guilty to murder charges in US National Guard shooting
subhead: Rahmanullah Lakanwal, 29, is charged with first-degree murder for the death of Sarah Beckstrom, 20, a National Guard member from West Virginia. Attorney General Pam Bondi has said she plans to seek the death penalty for Lakanwal, who allegedly drove cross-country to carry out the shooting near the White House on November 26.

title: All the magnetic poetry of Takis on display at Galerie Xippas in Paris
subhead: An exhibition showcases the diversity and coherence of the Greek artist's work, which includes aerial sculptures crafted from magnets.

title: Vanessa Dougnac: 'The supremacy of Hinduism in India is unprecedented: a form of internal colonization'
subhead: The journalist covered India for 25 years before being forced to leave the country under pressure from the Modi government. She reflects on her experiences and a new beginning in her book, 'Jungles.'
byline: Interview by Sophie Landrin (New Delhi, India, correspondent)

subhead: After the murder of Mehdi Kessaci, the brother of an activist against drug trafficking, Le Monde spoke with residents of housing projects, social workers, judges and police officers. They described a growing sense of powerlessness and danger.
byline: By Grégoire Biseau (Marseille (France) special correspondent) and Gilles Rof (Marseille (France) correspondent)

title: When private anger turns into a social force
subhead: In France, anger is everywhere: in the public sphere, in the media and at the ballot box. The majority of French people under the age of 35 say they have experienced it. From private feelings to collective outcries, they search for ways to channel this emotion.

title: The art of being Oscar Wilde's grandson
subhead: As Ireland prepares to mark the 125th anniversary of Oscar Wilde's death, Merlin Holland, his only living descendant, works in France to protect the memory of a man who was long viewed as scandalous.
